# Derivation

\[
p(\bar A)
= \frac{365}{365}\cdot \frac{364}{365}\cdot \frac{363}{365}\cdots \frac{365 - n + 1}{365}
= \frac{365!}{(365 - n)!}\cdot \frac{1}{365^n}.
\]

Thus, the probability for at least two people to share the same birthday is

\[
P(A) = 1 - P(\bar A)
= 1 - \frac{365!}{(365 - n)!}\cdot \frac{1}{365^n}
\]

# Log reformulation

\[
\log p(\bar A) = \log(365!) - \log((365 - n)!) - n \log(365).
\]

# Birthday function in use

```{r}
birthday(20:25)
```
